value: Central Bosaso with port in background.

peaceful city of 700,000, Bosaso is the main port and largest city of the semi-autonomous region of Puntland. Population have increased dramasticly during recent decades due to influx of refugees from the much-troubled southern regions.
is the country's third-most busiest airport but most flights are domestic. International flights are however avalible from

several times a week.

Reaching Bosaso by land is somewhat complicated, mainly due to the poruos security situation, the road leading from Puntland capital
have recently been paved but other roads are in bad condition or non-existent.

There is a bus service in Bosaso, Garowe, Qardho and Galkacyo. There are also services between the major towns and adjacent villages operated by different types of vehicles such as 4 wheel drives and light goods vehicles (LGV).
To travel outside of major cities, the central government requires foreigners to take an armed guard with them

Bosaso has white sandy beaches and clear sea water with a reef. Popular activities in the city include visiting internet cafés and coffee shops.
Additionally, there are many hotels that offer accommodation. Among the most prominent are the Hotel Huruuse, the Tropical, and the Hotel Juba.[29] The International Village hotel is especially noted for its domesticated ostriches.
The outskirts of Bosaso feature mountains, lakes and grasslands, with wildlife and trees. A panoramic view of the city's skyline can also be observed.
you can also go to Biyo Kulule which is a place you can visit and swim with natural hot water.
You can buy almost everything you want clothes,groceries,*
Rice with fish, rice with chicken,rice with fresh meat goat or camel,Pasta with all kinds, Somali food Etc....

fresh crushed ginger

sugar and milk
